page.title: 14PREMIERS HOME
page.content: {PREMIER'S HOME NEAR DUNSMORE In the heart of the Chiltern Hills stands one of the most famous houses in Britain, the country home of our Prime Ministers. Chequers Court was bequeathed to the nation for this purpose as a thanksgiving for the Allied victory in the Great War 1914_1918, by Lord Lee of Fareham. In the Deed of Settlement he hoped that the 'high and pure air of the hills and woods would be an antedote to the strenuous and resposible labours' of our political leaders. Since that time each succeeding Premier, exept Bonar Law, has used this beautiful house in its peaceful park for relaxing weekends, and possibly because of its isolated location, frequently for conferences. Many world leaders have been entertained there.
